enumNames: Not shown at all - used mainly to prevent spam
secureLevel.subject: MX.secureLevel
secureLevel.title: Secure level

DNASampleLocation.subject: MY.DNASampleLocation
DNASampleLocation.description: Leave empty if no sample taken, or if the sample is recorded separately
DNASampleLocation.title: DNA sample location

URL.subject: MY.URL
URL.description: URL where more information is available about the specimen
URL.title: URL

acquiredFrom.subject: MY.acquiredFrom
acquiredFrom.description: From who/where the specimen was acquired (if not recorded as a transaction)
acquiredFrom.title: Acquired from

acquiredFromOrganization.subject: MY.acquiredFromOrganization
acquiredFromOrganization.description: Organization where the accession was acquired from. If the organization is not on the list, add it first.
acquiredFromOrganization.title: Acquired from organization

acquisitionDate.subject: MY.acquisitionDate
acquisitionDate.description: Date (d.m.yyyy) or year (yyyy) on which the specimen was acquired to the collection. Empty means an old specimen acquired on an unknown date.
acquisitionDate.title: Acquisition date

additionalIDs.subject: MY.additionalIDs
additionalIDs.description: Other identifiers this specimen has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'mzhtypes:123' (old MAZ-type number)
additionalIDs.title: Additional ID's

bold.subject: MY.bold
bold.description: BOLD identifier, usually BOLD Sample ID. You can include additonal comment by separating them with colon, e.g. "AY123456:comments here"
bold.title: BOLD

cladBookID.subject: MY.cladBookID
cladBookID.description: Clad book id number or such
cladBookID.title: Clad book id

cladSpecimenID.subject: MY.cladSpecimenID
cladSpecimenID.description: Clad specimen id: usually color description and a number
cladSpecimenID.title: Clad specimen id

cladVerbatim.subject: MY.cladVerbatim
cladVerbatim.description: Verbatim specimen data from clad book
cladVerbatim.title: Clad data verbatim

collectionID.subject: MY.collectionID
collectionID.description: The collection which this specimen belongs to
collectionID.title: Collection

condition.subject: MY.condition
condition.description: Notes on the defects of the specimen (missing parts or such). Empty value means same as "good" or "hyvä" - that there is nothing special to mention about the condition.
condition.title: Condition (defects)

contacts.subject: MY.contacts
contacts.description: Contacts for people involved in the document
contacts.title: Contacts

cultivationInformation.subject: MY.cultivationInformation
cultivationInformation.description: Annuality/perenniality or other specialities about cultivation in our conditions.
cultivationInformation.title: Cultivation information

dataSource.subject: MY.dataSource
dataSource.description: Where the data about this specimen or observation is from, in addition to labels. Eg. reference to a publication, field notes or an expedition.
dataSource.title: Data source

det.subject: MY.det
det.description: Name of the identifier (person) preferably in format "lastname, firstname"
det.title: Det.

detDate.subject: MY.detDate
detDate.description: Date or year when the identification was done, preferably in format "d.m.Y" or "Y"
detDate.title: Det. date

documentLocation.subject: MY.documentLocation
documentLocation.description: Location of the specimen so that museum personnel can find it. E.g. taxon under which it is stored (if not clear from the identification), or shelf number
documentLocation.title: Specimen location

duplicatesIn.subject: MY.duplicatesIn
duplicatesIn.description: Description where duplicates (specimens of the same individual) are located or have been sent to and by which ID's.
duplicatesIn.title: Duplicates

editNotes.subject: MY.editNotes
editNotes.description: Reason for this edit or notes about it.
editNotes.title: Notes about this edit

entered.subject: MY.entered
entered.description: Date the data was first transcribed into electronic format or paper registry
entered.title: Date transcribed

event.subject: MY.event
event.description: Free-text diary-style information about what has been done to the specimen and when.
event.title: Event

exsiccatum.subject: MY.exsiccatum
exsiccatum.description: Name of the exsiccatum this specimen belongs to and possible exsiccatum number.
exsiccatum.title: Exsiccatum

formID.subject: MY.formID
formID.description: Id of the form that was used for the document
formID.title: Form id

id.subject: id
id.title: Id for the Global gathering event

@type.title: Type for the Global gathering event

@context.title: Context for the Global gathering event

genbank.subject: MY.genbank
genbank.description: Genbank identifier. You can include additonal comment by separating them with colon, e.g. "AY123456:comments here"
genbank.title: Genbank

labelsVerbatim.subject: MY.labelsVerbatim
labelsVerbatim.description: All text from labels word-for-word, including spelling errors. Separate each label on its own row, starting from topmost label.
labelsVerbatim.title: Verbatim labels

language.subject: MY.language
language.description: Language the data is (mainly) written in, if applicable.
language.title: Language

legID.subject: MY.legID
legID.description: Collecting number (field identifier, keruunumero) for the specimen
legID.title: Collecting number

notes.subject: MY.notes
notes.description: Additional information to the data in each section.
notes.title: Notes

originalSpecimenID.subject: MY.originalSpecimenID
originalSpecimenID.description: Original catalogue number or other  original identifier of the specimen. E.g. H9000000
originalSpecimenID.title: Original catalogue number

plannedLocation.subject: MY.plannedLocation
plannedLocation.description: Garden area where this accession is planned to be located.
plannedLocation.title: Planned location

preservation.subject: MY.preservation
preservation.description: Main method of preservation. If parts of the specimen are preserved in different ways, you can choose several methods.
preservation.title: Preservation

primaryDataLocation.subject: MY.primaryDataLocation
primaryDataLocation.description: Location of the primary data if not Kotka.
primaryDataLocation.title: Primary data location

privateNotes.subject: MY.privateNotes
privateNotes.description: Notes shown within the system for users signed in but not shown publicly anywhere. Use only for notes that absolutely need to be hidden from public view.
privateNotes.title: Nonpublic notes

publication.subject: MY.publication
publication.description: Publication references or doi's that refer to this specimen
publication.title: Publications

relationship.subject: MY.relationship
relationship.description: Relationship to another taxon OR specimen. Choose relationship type as prefix and give taxon name or specimen identifier thereafter, e.g. "parasite: Parasiticus specius" OR "host:http://tun.fi/JAA.123"
relationship.title: Relationship

sampleHistory.subject: MY.sampleHistory
sampleHistory.description: The history of the specimen, for example how it was acquired or in which museums it has been before.
sampleHistory.title: Specimen history

separatedFrom.subject: MY.separatedFrom
separatedFrom.description: ID of the specimen from which this has been separated
separatedFrom.title: Separated from specimen

separatedTo.subject: MY.separatedTo
separatedTo.description: ID's of those new specimens that have been separated from this specimen
separatedTo.title: Separated to specimen(s)

enumNames: Unrecoverable (location known, bet can't get it back)
status.subject: MY.status
status.description: Empty value means same as "ok" - that there is not anything special about the status of the specimen.
status.title: Status

transcriberNotes.subject: MY.transcriberNotes
transcriberNotes.description: Additional information regarding the data entry or transcription process, e.g. unclarities, explanations for interpretations,
transcriberNotes.title: Transcriber's notes

transferAgreement.subject: MY.transferAgreement
transferAgreement.description: Common name of agreement concerning the transfer, if any.
transferAgreement.title: Transfer agreement

unreliableFields.subject: MY.unreliableFields
unreliableFields.description: List of those fields that contain unreliable data. The list is created automatically.
unreliableFields.title: Unreliable fields

verificationStatus.subject: MY.verificationStatus
verificationStatus.description: Information about the quality of the specimen data. Possible to select several.
verificationStatus.title: Verification status

voucherSpecimenID.subject: MY.voucherSpecimenID
voucherSpecimenID.description: Identifier of the herbarium voucher specimen or information about it if the identifier is unknown.
voucherSpecimenID.title: Voucher specimen ID

owner.subject: MZ.owner
owner.description: Team or organisation that owns the record and can edit it.
owner.title: Owner of record

publicityRestrictions.subject: MZ.publicityRestrictions
publicityRestrictions.description: PUBLIC: all data can be published; PROTECTED: exact locality is hidden (100*100km square); PRIVATE: most of the data is hidden. Empty value means same as public.

administrativeProvince.subject: MY.administrativeProvince

administrativeProvince.title: Administrative province

alt.subject: MY.alt
alt.description: Altitude form sea level in meters, single value or range (E.g. 90, or 80-100). No GPS altitude here.
alt.title: Alt in meters

associatedObservationTaxa.subject: MY.associatedObservationTaxa
associatedObservationTaxa.description: Write associated observation taxa names here, separated by a semicolon (;). E.g.: "Betula pendula; Betula pubescens; Poaceae". These will form their own units of the type observation.
associatedObservationTaxa.title: Associated observation taxa

associatedSpecimenTaxa.subject: MY.associatedSpecimenTaxa
associatedSpecimenTaxa.description: Write associated specimen taxa names here, separated by a semicolon (;). E.g.: "Betula pendula; Betula pubescens; Poaceae". These will form their own units of the type Preserved specimen.
associatedSpecimenTaxa.title: Associated specimen taxa

DNASampleLocation.subject: MY.DNASampleLocation
DNASampleLocation.description: Leave empty if no sample taken, or if the sample is recorded separately

enumNames: Number of breeding sites (rocks, cavities, etc.)
abundanceUnit.subject: MY.abundanceUnit
abundanceUnit.title: Abundance unit

additionalIDs.subject: MY.additionalIDs
additionalIDs.description: Other identifiers this specimen has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'mzhtypes:123' (old MAZ-type number)
additionalIDs.title: Additional ID's

age.subject: MY.age
age.description: Estimated or known age in calendar years, years, days or other relevant unit.
age.title: Age

ageNotes.subject: MY.ageNotes
ageNotes.description: E.g. how age was determined, by whom and when.
ageNotes.title: Age notes

enumNames: 1 Unlikely breeding; Observed an individual of the species during the breeding season, but the observation does not suggest breeding in the respective atlas square

2 Possible breeding; Observed a single bird in one day (e.g. singing or displaying male, observed female) in the breeding season in a possible nesting habitat of the species, and breeding of the species in the atlas square is possible. Either the place was visited only once, or the bird was observed only once despite several visits.
3 Possible breeding; Observed a pair in one day in the breeding season in a possible nesting habitat, and breeding of the species in the atlas square is possible
4 Probable breeding; Observed a singing, displaying, or otherwise persistently staying male in the same place (i.e. on a permanent territory) on at least two days in the same breeding season
5 Probable breeding; Observed a female or a pair staying in the same place on at least two days in the same breeding season
6 Probable breeding; Observed a bird or pair in the breeding season in a manner strongly suggesting breeding
61 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair frequently visits a probable nesting site (e.g. regularly lands in the same reed bed or island)
62 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair builds a nest (digs or excavates a nest hole, carries nesting material, etc.)
63 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair gives warning calls because the nest or brood is apparently nearby
64 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair performs injury feigning such as broken-wing display or otherwise attempts to distract the observer away apparently from the nest or brood
65 Probable breeding; A bird or a pair dive-bombs or behaves otherwise threateningly toward the observer (e.g. owls and terns) because the nest or brood is apparently nearby
66 Probable breeding: Seen a nest with fresh nesting material (e.g. decorated nests of raptors) or food remains; however, no definite proof of eggs or chicks.
7 Confirmed breeding; Observed indirect evidence of confirmed breeding
71 Confirmed breeding; Seen used nest with eggs or eggshells, dead brood or remains of chicks, “dandruff” from feather sheaths etc., indicating that breeding occurred in the same year

72 Confirmed breeding; Observed a bird entering or leaving a nest in a way that clearly indicates breeding (although eggs or chicks have not been seen or chicks not heard, e.g. high nests or nest holes)
73 Confirmed breeding; Observed recently fledged young (nidicolous species) or downy young (nidifugous species) that can be considered born within the atlas square
74 Confirmed breeding; Observed an adult carrying or transporting food for young or a faecal sac, and the nest can be considered situating within the atlas square
75 Confirmed breeding; Adult seen incubating in the nest
8 Confirmed breeding; Observed direct evidence of confirmed breeding
81 Confirmed breeding; Direct evidence of a verified breeding detected: Nest with young heard (e.g. high nests or nest holes).
82 Confirmed breeding; Direct evidence of a verified breeding detected: Seen eggs or living young in the nest.
atlasCode.subject: MY.atlasCode
atlasCode.title: Breeding index

causeOfDeath.subject: MY.causeOfDeath
causeOfDeath.description: Cause of death, if not intentionally trapped on sampled
causeOfDeath.title: Cause of Death

chemistry.subject: MY.chemistry
chemistry.description: Results of chemical reaction tests etc.
chemistry.title: Chemical properties

count.subject: MY.count
count.description: Numeric or other description on the amount of individuals (or sprouts, fruiting bodies or such) in the specimen. Sexes and juveniles can be specified like so: 1m2f3j (=1 male, 2 females, 3 juveniles)
count.title: Count

decayStage.subject: MY.decayStage
decayStage.description: Estimation of decay stage (lahoaste in Finnish) on the scale of 1 to 5 and/or description
decayStage.title: Decay stage

enumNames: flight over or next to observer
distance.subject: MY.distance
distance.title: Distance

earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.subject: MY.earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.description: For palaeontological specimens, earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the specimen was collected
earliestEpochOrLowestSeries.title: Earliest epoch or lowest series

fruitType.subject: MY.fruitType
fruitType.description: Fruit type of the collected fruits, used for botanical garden accessions/seed bank.
fruitType.title: Fruit type

growthMediumName.subject: MY.growthMediumName
growthMediumName.description: Microbial culture growth medium name, usually from a standard
growthMediumName.title: Growth medium name

growthOtherConditions.subject: MY.growthOtherConditions
growthOtherConditions.description: Other growth conditions for the microbial culture, light etc.
growthOtherConditions.title: Other conditions for growth

enumNames: Herb-rich forest with broadleaved deciduous trees
Mountain birch forest in heath forest
Herb-rich forest with broadleaved deciduous trees

Mountain calcareous bedrock outcrop or boulder field
Mountain serpentine rock outcrop or boulder field
Spoil area, landfill or dumping ground

infestation.subject: MY.infestation
infestation.description: Description of the infestation status of the collected seeds, used for botanical garden accessions/seed bank.
infestation.title: Infestation

infrasubspecificSubdivision.subject: MY.infrasubspecificSubdivision
infrasubspecificSubdivision.description: Pathovars, serovars and other infrasubspecific subdivisions of microbes.
infrasubspecificSubdivision.title: Infrasubspecific subdivision

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

latestEpochOrHighestSeries.subject: MY.latestEpochOrHighestSeries
latestEpochOrHighestSeries.description: For palaeontological specimens, latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the specimen was collected.
latestEpochOrHighestSeries.title: Latest epoch or highest series

lifeStage.subject: MY.lifeStage
lifeStage.description: Life stage of the specimen. If multiple present, select the one which was present at the time of collecting. Use Life stage description field for extra information.
lifeStage.title: Life stage

lifeStageDescription.subject: MY.lifeStageDescription
lifeStageDescription.description: Free-text notes or addtional information about the life stage. If multiple values present, describe them here.
lifeStageDescription.title: Life stage description

macroscopy.subject: MY.macroscopy
macroscopy.description: Macroscopic features and measurements, if not recorded separately into measurement fields.
macroscopy.title: Macroscopic characters

measurement.subject: MY.measurement
measurement.title: Measurements
measurement.description: For measurements taken from the preparation/sample, use the measurement field in the preparation/sample section. For measurements taken from the specimen, use the measurements field on unit level.

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

microbiologicalRiskGroup.subject: MY.microbiologicalRiskGroup
microbiologicalRiskGroup.description: According to German TRBA August 2015, which is more comprehensive than the EU or Finnish list for bacterial risk groups
microbiologicalRiskGroup.title: Risk group

microscopy.subject: MY.microscopy
microscopy.description: Microscopic features and measurements, if not recorded separately into measurement fields.
microscopy.title: Microscopic characters

notes.subject: MY.notes
notes.description: Additional information to the data in each section.
notes.title: Notes

enumNames: E - spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TE - alien, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TVE - alien, resident, spreading in the wild, cultivated origin
TOVE - alien, old, resident (archaeotype), cultivated origin
TNVE - alien, new, resident, cultivated origin
TNSE - alien, new, ephemeral, cultivated origin
H - short distance escape from cultivation (inside a garden or similar)
plantStatusCode.subject: MY.plantStatusCode
plantStatusCode.description: Status code for the plant (wild, alien etc.)
plantStatusCode.title: Plant status code

populationAbundance.subject: MY.populationAbundance
populationAbundance.description: Abundance of the taxon in the field
populationAbundance.title: Abundance in the field

preparations.subject: MY.preparations
preparations.description: Preparations/preparates made from the specimen, if not recorded as separate Preparations/samples in the designated section
preparations.title: Preparations

preservation.subject: MY.preservation
preservation.description: Main method of preservation. If parts of the specimen are preserved in different ways, you can choose several methods.
preservation.title: Preservation

primarySpecimen.subject: MY.primarySpecimen
primarySpecimen.description: Can be used to highlight one unit as primary specimen/observation if there are many in one document. Only one unit per document can be marked as primary.
primarySpecimen.title: Primary specimen

enumNames: GW (cultivated, from seeds of wild source)
Z (propagule from wild source in cultivation)
provenance.subject: MY.provenance
provenance.description: Origin or source of the garden accession
provenance.title: Provenance

recordBasis.subject: MY.recordBasis
recordBasis.description: Type of record, most commonly preserved specimen for museum specimens and observation for associated observations ("seuralaislajihavainto").
recordBasis.title: Record type

recordParts.subject: MY.recordParts
recordParts.description: What parts of the record are / have been in storage.
recordParts.title: Record parts

ring.subject: MY.ring
ring.description: Bird or bat ring number, code, colour code or such
ring.title: Ring

seedMaturity.subject: MY.seedMaturity
seedMaturity.description: Maturity of the collected seeds, used for botanical garden accessions/seed bank.
seedMaturity.title: Seed maturity

seedMorphology.subject: MY.seedMorphology
seedMorphology.description: Seed morphology of the collected seeds, used for botanical garden accessions/seed bank.
seedMorphology.title: Seed morphology

sexNotes.subject: MY.sexNotes
sexNotes.description: E.g. how sex was determined, by whom and when.
sexNotes.title: Sex notes

detOnSite.subject: MY.detOnSite
detOnSite.description: Tehtiinkö lajin määritys havaintotilanteessa vai myöhemmin esimerkiksi internetin tai muiden kanssa keskustelun perusteella?
detOnSite.title: Determination on site

runningWaterInVicinity.subject: MY.runningWaterInVicinity
runningWaterInVicinity.title: Is the plant growing next to running water?

waterbirdObserverOpinionSelectedCensus.subject: MY.waterbirdObserverOpinionSelectedCensus
waterbirdObserverOpinionSelectedCensus.title: Make an interpretation based on this census

enumNames: 1) Laji ei varmasti pesi kohteella, linnut ruokailevia (esim. muuttomatkalla)
2) Alueella levähti 1. laskennan aikaan vielä runsaasti muuttajia ja tulkinta 2. laskennan perusteella
3) Lajin pesä(t) ovat jääneet jo kasvaneen järviruovikon suojiin 2. laskennassa, tulkinta tehty 1. laskennan perusteella
waterbirdPairCountOpinionReasoning.subject: MY.waterbirdPairCountOpinionReasoning
waterbirdPairCountOpinionReasoning.title: Reasoning for own interpretation

substrate.subject: MY.substrate
substrate.description: Type of substrate or name of substrate species.
substrate.title: Substrate

publicityRestrictions.subject: MZ.publicityRestrictions
publicityRestrictions.description: PUBLIC: all data can be published; PROTECTED: exact locality is hidden (100*100km square); PRIVATE: most of the data is hidden. Empty value means same as public.
publicityRestrictions.title: Publicity restrictions

associatedObservationTaxa.subject: MY.associatedObservationTaxa
associatedObservationTaxa.description: Write associated observation taxa names here, separated by a semicolon (;). E.g.: "Betula pendula; Betula pubescens; Poaceae". These will form their own units of the type observation.
associatedObservationTaxa.title: Associated observation taxa

det.subject: MY.det
det.description: Name of the identifier (person) preferably in format "lastname, firstname"
det.title: Det.

detDate.subject: MY.detDate
detDate.description: Date or year when the identification was done, preferably in format "d.m.Y" or "Y"
detDate.title: Det. date

detVerbatim.subject: MY.detVerbatim
detVerbatim.description: Name of the identifier and date of identification in original format (e.g. from the label), errors and all
detVerbatim.title: Det verbatim from the label or other original source

genusQualifier.subject: MY.genusQualifier
genusQualifier.description: Additional qualifier or specifier at genus level (e.g. aff., cf.)
genusQualifier.title: Genus qualifier

identificationNotes.subject: MY.identificationNotes
identificationNotes.description: Additional information on the identification, basis or such
identificationNotes.title: Identification notes

infraAuthor.subject: MY.infraAuthor
infraAuthor.description: Author for the taxon below species level/infra epithet
infraAuthor.title: Infra author

infraEpithet.subject: MY.infraEpithet
infraEpithet.description: Taxon name for the epithet below species level
infraEpithet.title: Infra name

infraRank.subject: MY.infraRank
infraRank.description: Taxonomic level of the epithet below species level
infraRank.title: Infra rank

infrasubspecificSubdivision.subject: MY.infrasubspecificSubdivision
infrasubspecificSubdivision.description: Pathovars, serovars and other infrasubspecific subdivisions of microbes.

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

preferredIdentification.subject: MY.preferredIdentification
preferredIdentification.description: This can be used to select one of the identifications as 'recommended', which is the used as default when displaying information about the specimen.
preferredIdentification.title: Preferred identification

sec.subject: MY.sec
sec.description: Publication reference for the taxon concept, that was used in identification
sec.title: Taxon concept (sec)

speciesQualifier.subject: MY.speciesQualifier
speciesQualifier.description: Additional qualifier at species level (e.g. aff., cf., sp. n., coll.)
speciesQualifier.title: Species qualifier

taxonID.subject: MY.taxonID
taxonID.description: ID for the taxon if has some other than an MX code
taxonID.title: Taxon alternative ID

taxonVerbatim.subject: MY.taxonVerbatim
taxonVerbatim.description: Taxon name in original format (e.g. from the label), errors and all
taxonVerbatim.title: Taxon verbatim

publicityRestrictions.subject: MZ.publicityRestrictions
publicityRestrictions.description: PUBLIC: all data can be published; PROTECTED: exact locality is hidden (100*100km square); PRIVATE: most of the data is hidden. Empty value means same as public.
publicityRestrictions.title: Publicity restrictions

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

typeBasionymePubl.subject: MY.typeBasionymePubl
typeBasionymePubl.description: Publication reference for original description or basionyme
typeBasionymePubl.title: Original description publication

typeSeriesID.subject: MY.typeSeriesID
typeSeriesID.description: ID for the type series, if part of one

typeStatus.subject: MY.typeStatus
typeStatus.description: Is this holotype, paratype, syntype etc...
typeStatus.title: Type of type

typeVerification.subject: MY.typeVerification
typeVerification.description: Verification whether this really is a type?
typeVerification.title: Type verification

typif.subject: MY.typif
typif.description: Name of the person who chose the type, preferably in the format "Lastname, firstname"
typif.title: Typefier

typifDate.subject: MY.typifDate
typifDate.description: Date when the specimen was chosen as a type
typifDate.title: Typifier date

publicityRestrictions.subject: MZ.publicityRestrictions
publicityRestrictions.description: PUBLIC: all data can be published; PROTECTED: exact locality is hidden (100*100km square); PRIVATE: most of the data is hidden. Empty value means same as public.
publicityRestrictions.title: Publicity restrictions

DNAExtractionInstrument.subject: MF.DNAExtractionInstrument
DNAExtractionInstrument.description: Name of the instrument or device used for DNA extraction
DNAExtractionInstrument.title: DNA extraction instrument

additionalIDs.subject: MF.additionalIDs
additionalIDs.description: Other identifiers this preparation/sample has, in format 'type:identifier'. For example: 'MZHtissue:123'. You can enter the type and colon and then click 'generate' to fetch the next free number for that prefix type.
additionalIDs.title: Preparation/sample additional sample IDs

bold.subject: MF.bold
bold.description: BOLD ID (usually BOLD "Sample ID") for the preparation/sample. If no other preparation/sample information is entered, use the BOLD field on the document level
bold.title: Sample BOLD ID

collectionID.subject: MF.collectionID
collectionID.description: The collection which this preparation/sample belongs to, if different from the collection of the specimen.
collectionID.title: Preparation/sample collection

condition.subject: MF.condition
condition.description: Notes on the defects of the preparation/sample (missing parts or such). For specimen level status use the condition field in the basic information section (document level). Empty value means same as "good" or "hyvä" - that the sample is in fine condition.
condition.title: Preparation/sample condition (defects)

datasetID.subject: MF.datasetID
datasetID.description: Tag for the preparation/sample. For specimen level tags, use the tag field in the basic information section (document level).
datasetID.title: Preparation/sample tag(s)

event.subject: MF.event
event.description: Diary-style information about what has been done to the preparation/sample
event.title: Events (maintenance etc.)

genbank.subject: MF.genbank
genbank.description: Genbank ID for the preparation/sample. If no other preparation/sample information is entered, use the Genbank field on the document level
genbank.title: Sample Genbank ID

individualsInPreparation.subject: MF.individualsInPreparation
individualsInPreparation.description: For example a jar that contains multiple fish individuals can be recorded as one specimen and one preparation. Can also be used for DNA samples (was DNA extracted from single or multiple individuals?).
individualsInPreparation.title: Single/multiple individual(s)?

material.subject: MF.material
material.description: Preparation/sample material. Choose preparation/sample type first.
material.title: Material

preparationDate.subject: MF.preparationDate
preparationDate.description: Date when the preparation/sample was prepared.
preparationDate.title: Preparation date

preparationMaterials.subject: MF.preparationMaterials
preparationMaterials.description: Materials (chemicals, kits etc.) used in the preparation process. It is possible to choose several.
preparationMaterials.title: Preparation process materials

preparationProcess.subject: MF.preparationProcess
preparationProcess.description: Processes used in the preparation. It is possible to choose several.
preparationProcess.title: Preparation process

preparationProcessNotes.subject: MF.preparationProcessNotes
preparationProcessNotes.description: Additional information about the preparation process.
preparationProcessNotes.title: Preparation process notes

preparedBy.subject: MF.preparedBy
preparedBy.description: Name of the person who prepared the preparation/sample, preferably in the format 'lastname, firstname'
preparedBy.title: Prepared by

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

preservation.subject: MF.preservation
preservation.description: Preservation methods and materials of the preparation/sample. It is possible to choose several
preservation.title: Preparation/sample preservation

publication.subject: MF.publication
publication.description: Publication references or doi's that refer to this preparations/sample. For publications referring to the specimen, use publications field in the Other section (document level).
publication.title: Preparation/sample publication(s)

quality.subject: MF.quality
quality.description: DNA sample quality on a three step scale. The quality is defined by quality check measurements
quality.title: DNA sample quality

qualityCheckDate.subject: MF.qualityCheckDate
qualityCheckDate.description: Date of the latest quality check measurements
qualityCheckDate.title: DNA quality check date

qualityCheckMethod.subject: MF.qualityCheckMethod
qualityCheckMethod.description: Method or instrument used for quality measurements
qualityCheckMethod.title: DNA quality check method

qualityNotes.subject: MF.qualityNotes
qualityNotes.description: Additional information about the DNA sample quality
qualityNotes.title: DNA quality notes

sampleLocation.subject: MF.sampleLocation
sampleLocation.description: Location of the preparation/sample so that museum personnel can find it. E.g. room, freezer, shelf number etc.
sampleLocation.title: Preparation/sample location

enumNames: Unrecoverable (location known, bet can't get it back)
status.subject: MF.status
status.description: Status of the preparation/sample. For specimen level status use the status field in the basic information section. Empty value means same as "ok" - that there is nothing special about the status of the sample.
status.title: Preparation/sample status

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

measurement.subject: MY.measurement
measurement.title: Measurements
measurement.description: For measurements taken from the preparation/sample, use the measurement field in the preparation/sample section. For measurements taken from the specimen, use the measurements field on unit level.

isPartOf.subject: MY.isPartOf
isPartOf.description: Which parent or larger collection this is part of.
isPartOf.title: Is part of

owner.subject: MZ.owner
owner.description: Team or organisation that owns the record and can edit it.
owner.title: Owner of record
